cz.ive.iveobject
Interface IveId

All Known Subinterfaces:
Area, GraphArea, GridArea, IveObject, Sensor, WayPoint
All Known Implementing Classes:
Area2DGrid, CommonArea, Ent, IveIdImpl, IveObjectImpl, SensorEye, SensorImpl, SimpleArea, WayPointImpl
public interface IveId

IveId labeled objects' interface IveId is represented as String value. In hierarchies of IveObjects, this Id is generated as concatenation of IveId of a parent, separator "." and the name of object beeing labeled.

Author:
ondra

Method Detail

getId

java.lang.String getId()
Getter for Id

Returns:
unique string id identifying this object

getFlatId

java.lang.String getFlatId()
Retrieves last part of the Id, which identify this object amongs its siblings.

Returns:
last part of the Id

getLeastCommonParent

IveObject getLeastCommonParent(IveId kin)
Finds the least common parent of actual and given IveId. Which means the first object in the parental hierarchy that is on both ways from objects to the root. This is just string comparison and ObjectMap lookup.

Parameters:
kin - IveId related with actual one
Returns:
lowest common parent or null if it is currently not present in the ObjectMap

getLeastCommonParentId

java.lang.String getLeastCommonParentId(java.lang.String kinId)
Finds the least common parent id of our id and given id. Which means id of the first object in the parental hierarchy that is on both ways from objects to the root. This is just string comparison.

Parameters:
kinId - String id of possible relative
Returns:
id of lowest common parent

getParent

IveObject getParent()
Lookups the parent in the ObjectMap

Returns:
parent or null if it is currently not present in the ObjectMap

getParentId

java.lang.String getParentId()
Finds id of our parent by just searching our String id.

Returns:
Strign id of our parent

getLeastActiveParent

IveObject getLeastActiveParent()
Looks for the least active parent. That is the first object on the way through the parental hierarchy to the root, found in the ObjectMap.

Returns:
the least active parent or null if none was found, which means that our Id is sort of broken, because at least the root of the parental hierarchy should be active all the time.

getLeastActiveParentWithLODLEThan

IveObject getLeastActiveParentWithLODLEThan(int i)
Looks for the least active parent with lod smaller than i.

Parameters:
i - must be bigger than 1
Returns:
the least active parent with lod lower than i or null if none was found, which means that our Id is sort of broken, because at least the root of the parental hierarchy should be active all the time.

isSibling

boolean isSibling(java.lang.String siblingId)
Queries whether our and the given id has the same parent

Parameters:
siblingId - String id of possible sibling
Returns:
true iff the given id really is our sibling

isSibling

boolean isSibling(IveId sibling)
Queries whether our and the given object has the same parent

Parameters:
sibling - possible sibling
Returns:
true iff the given object really is our sibling

isParent

boolean isParent(IveId parent)
Tests whether the given id is (not necessarily direct) parent of this object. It is realized only by string comparison of ids.

Parameters:
parent - Id to test on parentship
Returns:
true if the given id is predecessor of this object, false otherwise

getChildPreceedingId

java.lang.String getChildPreceedingId(java.lang.String descendantId)
Finds first descendant from this Id to the given childId. This is being done only on the level of String ids, no ObjectMap querry is needed. Note that if the descendant is direct, than its id will be returned. On the other hand our id is not correct answer even if the given id was ours one.

Parameters:
descendantId - id of our (usually not direct) descendant
Returns:
String id of our child on the way to given descendant or null if we are not a parent of given id.

getChildPreceeding

IveObject getChildPreceeding(java.lang.String descendantId)
Finds first descendant IveObject from this Id to the given child. The real IveObject is retrieved from the ObjectMap. Note that if the descendant is direct, than it will be returned as being the first child on the way to itself. On the other hand we shall never return IveObject representing this Id.

Parameters:
descendantId - id of our (usually not direct) descendant
Returns:
our child IveObject on the way to given descendant or null if we are not a parent of given id or if the child is currently not in the ObjectMap.
